Optimise Your Website

Transform Your Organisation

Getting visitors to your website is not getting easier or cheaper in 2018.
Optimise your website and convert more of your precious visitors.
If you pay for traffic optimising is essential.

When you make the breakthrough the effect on your organisation is transformational.

 
More customers / suscribers / donors

Tune


Your visitors expect your website to be relevant and LOAD FAST. Optimise for all devices. NOTE: Your competitors are a click away.

Analyse


Important decisions need accurate data. Collect data on everything that is important. Know for sure what is working and what is undermining your success.

Experiment


Always be improving. Test new ideas against your current best and grow with the winners.

Engage


Email marketing allows you to reach out to customers and prospects whenever you need.

Tune your website for higher conversion

Don't drive your visitors into the waiting arms of your competitors

If your website is slow to load and does not dispay well on your visitors devices, especially smart phones, you need to fix the problems as soon as possible. People dislike slow loading websites. If you make people wait, they will abandon their visit and probably go directly to one of your competitors. Search engines want to serve the best possible results to their visitors. Search engines do not favour slow loading sites. Equaly, if your website is difficult to navigate or does not display optimally on visitors preferred devices, they will bounce. Search engines do not reward high bounce rate.

Learn more about tuning your website and reducing visitor bounce rate(tune headers, footers, contact, faq to be always closing)

Set up Analytics to measure your success

Without reliable numbers you will not know if your optimisation efforts are having the desired effect

Know which sources are sending the most valuable visitors and where the timewasters are coming from. See which content is generating the most interest. Find out what visitors are doing on your web pages and what might be causing them to bounce.

Learn more about integrating an analytics system with your website

Set Up a Testing Tool and run Experiments

A testing tool allows you to experiment with new ideas on your website without needing to involve your IT people

Rather than relying on gut feeling or opinion to determine the appropriate page or website design, you can run an experiment that tests the alternate designs with real-world users and get results that are simple to read and understand.

When you run experiments you challenge the status quo and will uncover new ways to grow your organisation

Learn more about integrating a testing system with your website

Email Marketing

Don't throw away opportunity. Collect the email address of as many website visitors as possible and contact them regularly.

Expecting people to remember you and come back to your site is too risky. Paying to get them to come back again is too expensive.

Learn more about integrating email marketing with your website
